title: 2019 Dayton shooting
summary: On August 4, 2019, 24-year-old Connor Betts shot and killed nine people, including his sister, and injured 17 others near the entrance of the Ned Peppers Bar in the Oregon District of Dayton, Ohio.[3] Betts was fatally shot by responding police officers 32 seconds after the first shots were fired.[3][5] A total of 27 people were taken to area hospitals.[5]
